      • build

        public GenericFutureOption build()

      • productId

        public GenericFutureOption.Builder productId(StandardId productId)
        Sets the base product identifier.

        The identifier that is used for the base product, also known as the symbol. A future option typically expires monthly or quarterly, thus the product referred to here is the base product of a series of contracts. A unique identifier for the contract is formed by combining the base product, put/call, strike and expiry month. For example, 'Eurex~OGBL' could be used to refer to the Euro-Bund option base product at Eurex.

        Parameters:
        productId - the new value, not null
        Returns:
        this, for chaining, not null

      • expiryMonth

        public GenericFutureOption.Builder expiryMonth(YearMonth expiryMonth)
        Sets the expiry month.

        The month used to identify the expiry of the option. When the option expires, trading stops.

        Options expire on a specific date, but as there is typically only one contract per month, the month is used to refer to the future. Note that it is possible for the expiry date to be in a different calendar month to that used to refer to the option.

        Parameters:
        expiryMonth - the new value, not null
        Returns:
        this, for chaining, not null

      • putCall

        public GenericFutureOption.Builder putCall(PutCall putCall)
        Sets whether the option is put or call.

        A call gives the owner the right, but not obligation, to buy the underlying at an agreed price in the future. A put gives a similar option to sell.

        Parameters:
        putCall - the new value
        Returns:
        this, for chaining, not null

      • strikePrice

        public GenericFutureOption.Builder strikePrice(double strikePrice)
        Sets the strike price, represented in decimal form.

        This is the price at which the option applies and refers to the price of the underlying future. This must be represented in decimal form.

        No indication is provided as to the meaning of one unit of this price. It may be an amount in a currency, a percentage or something else entirely.

        Parameters:
        strikePrice - the new value
        Returns:
        this, for chaining, not null

      • expiryDate

        public GenericFutureOption.Builder expiryDate(LocalDate expiryDate)
        Sets the expiry date, optional.

        This is the date that the option expires. A generic future option is intended to be used for future options that expire monthly or quarterly. As such, the expiryMonth field is used to identify the contract and this date is primarily for information.

        Parameters:
        expiryDate - the new value
        Returns:
        this, for chaining, not null

      • tickSize

        public GenericFutureOption.Builder tickSize(double tickSize)
        Sets the size of each tick.

        The tick size is defined as a decimal number. If the tick size is 1/32, the tick size would be 0.03125.

        Parameters:
        tickSize - the new value
        Returns:
        this, for chaining, not null

      • tickValue

        public GenericFutureOption.Builder tickValue(CurrencyAmount tickValue)
        Sets the monetary value of one tick.

        When the price changes by one tick, this amount is gained/lost.

        Parameters:
        tickValue - the new value, not null
        Returns:
        this, for chaining, not null

      • underlyingQuantity

        public GenericFutureOption.Builder underlyingQuantity(long underlyingQuantity)
        Sets the quantity of the underlying future that the option refers to, defaulted to 1.

        An option typically refers to one future, and this will be set by default.

        Parameters:
        underlyingQuantity - the new value
        Returns:
        this, for chaining, not null

      • underlyingLink

        public GenericFutureOption.Builder underlyingLink(SecurityLink<GenericFuture> underlyingLink)
        Sets the link to the underlying future.

        This property returns a link to the security via a StandardId. See GenericFutureOption.getUnderlying() and SecurityLink for more details.

        Parameters:
        underlyingLink - the new value
        Returns:
        this, for chaining, not null
